senses.de: To allow or let something happen.
senses.ex: My parents permit me to go to the movies on weekends.

Tips.title: Permission Levels
Tips.description: The level of permission can vary, from limited circumstances to general approval.
Tips.example: They permit swimming here, but not diving.

Tips.title: Permission Source
Tips.description: Permission is often granted by someone in authority, like parents or officials.
Tips.example: Does the teacher permit talking during work time?

Tips.title: Conditional Terms
Tips.description: A permit can have conditions that specify when the action is allowed.
Tips.example: You can go out if you finish your homework.

senses.de: An official document that allows you to do something.
senses.ex: You need a special permit to park here.

Tips.title: Legal Requirement
Tips.description: Some activities strictly require a permit, or you could face legal consequences.
Tips.example: Building a house typically requires a construction permit.

Tips.title: Specific Purpose
Tips.description: A permit is often issued for a specific purpose and may not be used for anything else.
Tips.example: A fishing permit won't allow you to hunt.

Tips.title: Temporary Validity
Tips.description: Permits usually have an expiration date and must be renewed.
Tips.example: Her work permit expires next month.

senses.ex: The boss's absence permit us to leave early.

Tips.title: Possibility to Act
Tips.description: This definition highlights that a situation makes a certain action possible.
Tips.example: The sunny weather permits a day at the beach.

Tips.title: Implying Empowerment
Tips.description: Permit can suggest empowerment by removing obstacles or restrictions.
Tips.example: New technology permits more accurate research.

Allow.wordDefinition:
Both words allow and permit have similar meanings and are almost interchangeable.

Allow is a more general word that implies giving permission or giving someone the authority to do something. For example, you may allow a friend to enter your home or allow your child to stay up late.

To summarize, allow is more casual and can be used in everyday situations, while permit is more formal and often refers to official authorization.

Approve.wordDefinition:
Approve means to give permission or consent after careful consideration or evaluation.

For example, a teacher may approve a student's project proposal after reviewing it.

Approve involves evaluating and consenting to something, while permit involves granting official permission for something to happen.

Authorize.wordDefinition:
The words authorize and permit both mean to give someone the go-ahead or approval to do something.

Authorize is used when someone or something has the power or authority to give permission. For example, a bank might authorize a transaction on your account, meaning they give approval for the money to be moved.

In summary: Authorize means to give permission because you have the power or authority to do so, while permit means to allow something to happen even if you don't necessarily have complete control over it.

Consent.wordDefinition:
Consent refers to giving permission or agreeing to something that involves a decision. It generally implies that there is a level of understanding and willingness to participate or allow something to happen.

For example, if someone asks for your consent to use your photo in a project, they are asking for your permission to do so.

Consent is more about agreement and allowing while permit is more about permission being granted for an otherwise restricted activity or action.

Empower.wordDefinition:
Empower means to give someone the ability or authority to do something. For example, a teacher might empower their students by giving them the responsibility to lead a class discussion.

Empower is used when someone is given the ability or authority to do something, while permit is used when someone is given permission to do something.

Entitle.wordDefinition:
Entitle means to give someone the right or claim to something. For example, if you work for a company, you may be entitled to certain benefits like health insurance or vacation time.

Entitle refers to giving someone a right or claim to something, while the word permit refers to allowing or giving permission for something to happen or be done.

License.wordDefinition:
A license is an official document that gives an individual permission to do something that is typically regulated by a government or authority.

For example, a driver's license gives someone permission to drive a car legally on public roads.

A license is more permanent and signifies that someone has met certain requirements, while a permit is more temporary and allows someone to do something specific for a limited time.

Sanction.wordDefinition:
Sanction means to give official approval or to impose a penalty for breaking a rule or law. For example, if a company violates environmental regulations, they may face sanctions such as fines or legal action from the government.

Permit is used when someone is being allowed to do something, while sanction is used when there are consequences for breaking rules or laws.
